com.astamuse.asta4d.web.form.flow.base

Interface BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Superinterfaces:
    CascadeArrayFunctions, FormFlowTraceDataAccessor, ValidationProcessor
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, MultiInputStepFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>, OneStepFormHandlerTrait<T>, UpdatableFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>

    public interface BasicFormFlowHandlerTrait<T>
extends CascadeArrayFunctions, FormFlowTraceDataAccessor, ValidationProcessor
    The basic mechanism of form flow. This interface is implemented as a template which allows developer to override any method for customization.

    To define a form flow, we need to plan a flow graph which describes how the flow flows.

    (before first) --> step 1 <--> step2 <--> step3 <--> ... --> (exit)

    Assume we have a flow as above, note that there can be cycles or branches, which means you can go any step from any other step in the flow graph, what you need to do is to define how the step should be transfered.

    The FormProcessData interface defined the basic step information and the default implementation SimpleFormProcessData retrieves the step information from the submitted http query parameters which can be put into the HTML template files as a part of the submitting form. However you can always decide how to retrieve the step information by implement your own FormProcessData.

    The retrieved FormProcessData will suggest the following things:

    • step to exit
    • step to back
    • current step
    • step for failing
    • step for success
    • flow trace id
    The default implementation of #process() will decide where the flow goes to by following sequence:
    1. if step to exit does not empty, then exit the current flow by decide the render target step to be null
    2. if the current step is empty, then treat the current step as "before first" step
    3. if the current step "before first", then decide the render target step by firstStepName()
    4. if the step to back is not empty, then decide the render target step to be the step to back.
    5. then calling processForm(FormProcessData, Object) to process the submitted form data
    6. if the result of process is success, then decide the render target step to be the step for success, otherwise to be the step of failing
    See #process() for more details of what will be done.

    Then the following things is left for developers to decide as a rule of the flow:

    • override #createTemplateFilePathForStep(String) to decide how to convert a step to the corresponding target template file path.
    • override FormFlowTraceDataAccessor.skipStoreTraceData(String, String, FormFlowTraceData) to decide whether the flow trace data should be stored
    • override passDataToSnippetByFlash(String, String, FormFlowTraceData) to decide how to pass the form data for rendering to snippet
    For most common situations, all the above things can be decided as general rules in the user project, so that a common parent class can be utilized to perform the common assumption. There are two built-in flows representing the classical situations: OneStepFormHandlerTrait and ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait. Those two built-in interfaces can also be considered as reference implementation of how to design and decide a form flow. User project is always recommended to extend from those two built-in flows rather than this basic trait.

    In user project, a common parent class is always recommended. A project limited common parent class can be used to decide the special rules of the project and the following two method is strongly recommended to be overridden to return a configured validator.

    • ValidationProcessor.getTypeUnMatchValidator()
    • ValidationProcessor.getValueValidator()
    Author:
    e-ryu
    See Also:
    BasicFormFlowSnippetTrait, OneStepFormHandlerTrait, ClassicalMultiStepFormFlowHandlerTrait

      • process

        default String process(FormProcessData processData)
                throws Exception
        This method implement the basic mechanism which performs following things:
        1. restore the trace data map which contains all the data in each step
        2. retrieve instance of target form data which type is specified by getFormCls()
        3. if the current step is before first, set the render target step by firstStepName()
        4. if the back step is not empty, then set the back step name to render target step
        5. else call processForm(FormProcessData, Object) method to process the retrieved form data, currently in the process method, only #validateForm(FormProcessData, Object) is invoked to perform validation.
        6. call rewriteTraceDataBeforeGoSnippet(String, String, FormFlowTraceData) to rewrite trace data
        7. if FormFlowTraceDataAccessor.skipStoreTraceData(String, String, FormFlowTraceData) returns true, call FormFlowTraceDataAccessor.clearStoredTraceData(String) to clear stored trace data, or call FormFlowTraceDataAccessor.storeTraceData(String, String, String, FormFlowTraceData) to store the trace data for next step process
        8. call #passDataToSnippet(String, String, Map) to store all the retrieved and processed data for page rendering
        9. return the render target step name
        Sub classes could override this method to translate the returned target step to the actual render target template file path.
        Returns:
        the render target step name
        Throws:
        Exception

      • exitWhenTraceDataMissing

        default boolean exitWhenTraceDataMissing()
        Whether the form flow should be exit when the target trace data is not found. The default is true.
        Returns:

      • processForm

        default CommonFormResult processForm(FormProcessData processData,
                                     T form)
        The default process will only call the #validateForm(Object) and sub classes can override this method to add extra process logics such as updating form when validation succeeds.
        Parameters:
        processData -
        form -
        Returns:

      • retrieveFormInstance

        default T retrieveFormInstance(FormFlowTraceData traceData,
                               String currentStep)
        Sub classes can override this method to customize how to retrieve the form instance by step information. By default, a form instance will be retrieved from context by calling generateFormInstanceFromContext(String).
        Parameters:
        traceMap -
        currentStep -
        Returns:

      • generateFormInstanceFromContext

        default T generateFormInstanceFromContext(String currentStep)
        Sub classes can override this method to do some interception around form instance generation, especially some post processes.

        NOTE: DO NOT replace this method completely at sub class, if you want to do some customized form retrieving, override the method #retrieveFormInstance(Map, String) instead.

        Parameters:
        currentStep -
        Returns:

      • rewriteTraceDataBeforeGoSnippet

        default void rewriteTraceDataBeforeGoSnippet(String currentStep,

                                             FormFlowTraceData traceData)

        Parameters:

      • passDataToSnippet

        default void passDataToSnippet(String currentStep,
                               String renderTargetStep,
                               String traceId,
                               FormFlowTraceData traceData)
        Sub classes can override this method to customize how to pass data to snippet.

        This method will retrieve the form of render target from trace map and if it does not exists, the form of current step will be used. By default, the render target form is not set so the current step form will be used always. The sub classes could override this method to store the render target form to trace map before calling super.

        Parameters:
        currentStep -
        renderTargetStep -
        traceMap -

      • passData

                      Object data)

                                         String renderTargetStep,
                                         FormFlowTraceData traceData)

        Parameters:

        renderTargetStep -
        form -
        result -
        Returns:
